com.magnet.android.mms.async

Class AsyncCallOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.android.mms.async.Options
      • com.magnet.android.mms.async.AsyncCallOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class AsyncCallOptions
extends Options
    The options for an asynchronous (non-guaranteed delivery) call. The default settings are as follows:
    • One thread per call.
    • The cache age is 0 (discard cached result).
    • A cache over constraint policy is used (check the cache before evaluating the constraint).
    • There is no implicit constraint used.
    • There is no token (duplicated requests are not checked).
    • No custom contextual tags are included, except for system level contextual tags.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • checkCache

        public AsyncCallOptions checkCache(boolean cacheFirst)
        Deprecated. Use checkCacheFirst(boolean)
        Check the availability of the cached result before evaluating the constraint. The default is true.
        Parameters:
        cacheFirst - Set to true to check the cache first; set to false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.

      • checkCacheFirst

        public AsyncCallOptions checkCacheFirst(boolean cacheFirst)
        Check the availability of the cached result before evaluating the constraint. The default is true.
        Parameters:
        cacheFirst - Set to true to check the cache first; set to false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.

      • setConstraint

        public AsyncCallOptions setConstraint(Constraint constraint)
        Specify a constraint determining when the call can be invoked. Typically a result cache will be checked for availability before evaluating the constraint. The caller can flip the sequence by passing a value of false to checkCache(boolean).
        Parameters:
        constraint - A constraint that determines when the call can be invoked.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.

      • setToken

        public AsyncCallOptions setToken(String token)
        Specify a unique token for a call to avoid an unintended duplicated outstanding call. Be careful when sharing an AsyncCallOptions object with the same token used by multiple calls; some calls may be treated as duplicated invocations. When a duplicated token is detected, the original Call object will be returned, and no callback will be issued.
        Parameters:
        token - An application-wide unique token, or null if not set.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.

      • setStateChangedListener

        public AsyncCallOptions setStateChangedListener(StateChangedListener listener)
        Set the listener for the State Changed event.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener for the State Changed event.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.
        See Also:
        StateChangedHandler

      • setCacheAge

        public AsyncCallOptions setCacheAge(int duration,
                           TimeUnit unit,
                           boolean useCacheIfOffline)
        Set an acceptable age for a cached result. Without using this option or setting the duration to 0, the result will always come from the server. Otherwise, if the result is available its age is within the duration, it will be fetched from the cache. In offline mode, if useCacheIfOffline is set to true, the result will be fetched from the cache.
        Parameters:
        duration - Set to 0 to discard the cache immediately, specify Options.NO_CACHE_AGE for no cache age, or specify a value greater than 0.
        unit - The time units for the duration.
        useCacheIfOffline - Set to true to always use cache if offline; set to false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.

      • addTag

        public AsyncCallOptions addTag(Class<? extends Tag> tag,
                      Call.When when)
        Add a tag to a call when the call is made or sent. The tag value is evaluated dynamically for each call. It is different from the static tag in addTag(String, String) and addTags(Map). A duplicated tag will be overwritten. Without queuing, there is no difference between Call.When.SUBMIT and Call.When.SEND.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag to be added to the call.
        when - Specify Call.When.SUBMIT or Call.When.SEND.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.
        See Also:
        Tag.GEOLOCATION, Tag.NETWORK, Tag.REQUEST_TIME

      • addTag

        public AsyncCallOptions addTag(String name,
                      String value)
        Add a static tag to a call. The tag value remains unchanged. A duplicated tag will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        name - The tag name.
        value - The tag value.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the tag name is invalid.
        See Also:
        Tag.GEOLOCATION, Tag.NETWORK, Tag.REQUEST_TIME

      • addTags

        public AsyncCallOptions addTags(Map<String,String> tags)
        Add a set of static tags to a call. The tag values remain unchanged. Duplicated headers will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        tags - A map of name-value pairs.
        Returns:
        The asynchronous call options.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - A tag has an invalid name.
        See Also:
        Tag.GEOLOCATION, Tag.NETWORK, Tag.REQUEST_TIME
